content.description:
No Crux here! Follow the path of least resistance and clips a few bolts for safety as you cruise up to the ridge line for a nice walk off back down towards the lake!



This is an exit route from the Upper Walls to the ridge top so that you can walk off, down and around to the old road at the bottom. 

From the Lunch Log, walk north-ish along the base of the cliff. If you reach bolts with static rope hanging from them, then you have gone slightly too far. Backup a few meters and look up and right. Follow the easy angled, treed ledge up and right, probably more right than up, and look for 1/2 dozen bolts or so along this 55m pitch. Relatively straightforward 5th class scrambling, but since there cliff edge is so close and there is some loose terrain, it's nice to use a rope to stay protected in case of a slip.

Once on the top of ridge, follow a trail down the ridge. There's many animals trails here as well, and also multiple ways down, so test out your route findings skills!! :D

Enjoy!

Bolted. 6 bolts. A pair of bolts at the top for the station.

Pitch 1 (5.10a, 6 bolts, 25m) Great rock and fun face climbing up to a ring bolt belay.

Pitch 2 (5.9, 5 bolts, 21m) A bit more variety on this pitch from nice rock to mossy steps! 

Pitch 3 (5.8, 7 bolts, 23m) The fun part! Traverse out right from the belay towards the obvious chimney! Wrestle with the chimney for a short while before emerging out of it and up onto the ledge. This ledge has a 2 bolt station. Belay your partner up to here if you wish to go walking around on the top. But 3 more bolts on a traverse out left from here will get you to the rap rings so that you can descend by rappelling.

Alternate Pitch 3 ... see Man Date Direct Finish.

Descent: With a 70m rope you can rappel 35m down to top of Pitch 1, and 2nd rappel gets you to the base of the route. With a 60m rope, you will have to do three rappels. 



From the "Lunch Log", go left, emerge from the trees and trend up the gully until you see the first bolt.

Bolted. Rap Hangers at each station as you rappel the route to get back down.

Pitch 1 (5.10a, 6 bolts, 25m) Great rock and fun face climbing up to a ring bolt belay. Same as Man Date.

Pitch 2 (5.9, 5 bolts, 21m) A bit more variety on this pitch from nice rock to mossy steps! Same as Man Date.

Pitch 3 (5.10d, 7 bolts, 20m) A fantastic direct line finish for the 3rd pitch! Follow bolts straight up the face towards the ring bolts above!

Descent: With a 70m rope you can rappel 35m down to top of Pitch 1, and 2nd rappel gets you to the base of the route. With a 60m rope, you will have to do three rappels. 



From the "Lunch Log", go left, emerge from the trees and trend up the gully until you see the first bolt.

Bolted. Rap Hangers at each station as you rappel the route to get back down.
This crag is north facing and mostly shady, but also somewhat protected from the wind! It is great on a hot summer day!
